content: I will be beginning the migration of the www.hl7.org web server late tomorrow afternoon. There will be times on 11/22 where hl7.org/anything will not be available. I expect to continue work through into the weekend as necessary.

In approximately 3 hours I will begin the switch to the new HL7 web server. All hl7.org/anything will be down. There are database updates that will happen during the downtime. After the switch, I will be available all evening and all weekend for any and all feedback. If you see something not working properly, please let me know!
The update has been moved to after 5 pm.
In 30 minutes, hl7.org will be unavailable for the moving of the server.

The site will be available by 8:00 PM Eastern. Batch processes are complete. I do expect there to be a few cosmetic issues and errors as more people come back on. I look forward to addressing each issue.

The hl7.org website is back online on the new server. I will continue to work on any and all bugs throughout the weekend. I will be monitoring email for errors. I expect to be available between 8 am and 8 pm Eastern tomorrow and Sunday.

@David Johnson I don't seem to have received the typical bolus of meeting notifications this weekend. Is that due to the server move? (can't say as I missed going through all of them on Monday morning...)
There are known issues with file downloads on hl7.org. I am working on it this morning. Files appear to download but are showing corrupt when opening. Not all files, but some.
It is. I will be resending todays. There was a change in how mail is handled between the old and new versions. It requires coding updates. I hope to have these in place this afternoon.

@David Johnson For me URLs pointing to older versions like https://www.hl7.org/fhir/stu3/ end up in a HTTP Error 500.52 - URL Rewrite Module Error while https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/ works, did I miss something ?
this is my error. And I'll fix it
@Yunwei Wang I've reported to webmaster. Will move updates off of announcements thread

http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/version.info now returns

HTTP Error 404.3 - Not Found
The page you are requesting cannot be served because of the extension configuration.
If the page is a script, add a handler. If the file should be downloaded, add a MIME map.
#Announcements is not a place for discussion of issues, just for the initial announcement of planned downtime. Please move discussion of issues resulting from the move to #implementers
